verses.verse: (Divine Majesty and Human Dignity) To the leader: according to The Gittith. A Psalm of David. (Ps 66.2; 113.4; 148.13) O LORD, our Sovereign, how majestic is your name in all the earth! You have set your glory above the heavens.
(Ps 44.16; Mt 21.16) Out of the mouths of babes and infants you have founded a bulwark because of your foes, to silence the enemy and the avenger.
(Ps 89.11; 102.25; 136.9) When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars that you have established;
(Job 7.17; Ps 144.3; Heb 2.6) what are humans that you are mindful of them, mortals (Heb son of man) that you care for them?
(Ps 21.5; 103.4; Heb 2.9) Yet you have made them a little lower than God (Or than the divine beings or angels) and crowned them with glory and honor.
(Gen 1.26; Heb 2.8) You have given them dominion over the works of your hands; you have put all things under their feet,
all sheep and oxen, and also the beasts of the field,
the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, whatever passes along the paths of the seas.
(v 1) O LORD, our Sovereign, how majestic is your name in all the earth!
